content.description: To the R of Ducks. After a steep start Connect the chicken heads to an overlap, place some poorish gear and launch for the faint flake, the crux is leaving the flake via poor crimps to gain more chicken heads. Diego did 1st ascent OS!
content.protection: Sling chicken heads and yellow/green aliens and small wires, finishes at anchor of ducks

content.description: start up Ugly and traverse L wards into Bondage. An accidental FA
content.protection: trad to 2 bolt anchor of Bondage

climbs.name: S&M Airlines
climbs.fa: Tyler Phillips, Craig Martin and Juli Salmi

content.description: Link chickenheads on the left side of the Ducks in Bondage slab. Although this was drilled on lead, the pro is perfect. It's easy to rap to these anchors on your way back down from the top of Ducks in Bondage. If you are on TR, the direct start is highly recommended.
content.protection: A finger sized piece to get to the first bolt, then 3 or 4 more bolts. The pro is just right for this but you'll still need a 70m rope because this is foreshortened by 40' of low angle approach slab to the climbing proper.
content.location: Starts on the first bolt of Ducks in Bondage, with an improbably cool traverse left on chickenheads, then heads straight up for 3 or 4 more bolts to a 2 bolt anchor.

content.description:
The highlight of the crag! Slab climbing is

way

more fun when you have an obvious point of security to shoot for. Like Dark of the Moon, there is constant motivation to connect the dots between a

ll those c

hickenheads,

with the extra bonus of a few flakes and edges.

Pad up the initial 30' of very low angle 5.0 slab, shooting for the initial crack in the middle/left of the face. Place a piece, then mantle and slidepull your way up the heavily featured face. Slab geeks may find themselves smiling and grinning their way past the many chickenheads, flakes, edges Â interspersed with large, dishy smears here and there.

There is an anchor station mid-way and after there, it's

progressively

easier

yet

progressively

runout

climbing to a 2 bolt anchor. I think there may be one or two pins on the second half but the reduction in grade helped the run out feel reasonable.

Keep moving and don't think about it!
content.protection: The full LCC quiver of slung chickeheads, cams, a few bolts and old pitons. 2 rappels with a 70m rope get you back to the ground.
content.location: Starts in the middle left of the face, where a crack meets the lower angled slab.

content.description: Mixed. Singles to #3. Another fun pitch, but a bit more serious.
content.location: furthest R route on the slab
